name: Chitwa Chitwa Private Game Reserve

reviews.text: There's really not much else to say! We had the most incredible tine at Chitwa Chitwa. Every single person on the staff knew our name, and they were all so helpful, accomodating, and interesting. Raxon, our amazing guide, and Moses, our incredibe tracker, deserve a special mention -- they made our whole stay worthwhile. We saw the first leopard the camp had seen in 5 days on our first game drive, as well as lions and elephants. Raxon let us watch the leopard for a long time before he radioed to the other vehicles aout her -- it was a truly amazing experience. We saw the Big 5 many times over as well as many lesser animals that were incredible too. The amount of sightings we had in comparison to the other lodges we went to was incomparable!! We saw so much more here.
reviews.title: Fantastic, fantastic, fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Raxon took us to his and Moses' hometown and introduced us to his family and showed us around the village, which was so touching. It's incredible all the things he's doing to support his village! This cannot be missed.
reviews.title: Paradise on earth
Very nice, excellent service
reviews.text: The rooms are also fantastic -- very modern and tastefully decorated while keeping with the African style, as well as free WiFi and a free, all-access minibar.

reviews.title: Amazing place
reviews.text: Not to mention the food is fantastic and the iced coffee is simply divine! You can't make a bad choice by coming here!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These few lines couldn't even tell you the beginning of the dream come true we lived in this lodge. Perfect is a word that could only be created to describe it. The lodge, the display, the staff, the meals, the safaris....everything was way beyond all you can imagine.... The most exclusive experience we could have dreamt of. A honeymoon it was, let's say it's the most beautiful way to celebrate our union, thank you everyone there !!!!
reviews.title: honeymoon to remember!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived with another couple in absolutely pouring rain as there had been a cyclone over Mozambique. It was raining so hard they were unable to fly us in so we were driven in which was quite an adventure. Unfortunately the rains continued and we only got 2 out of 6 game drives. What can you do when the weather doesn't co-operate???
reviews.title: Trip of a Lifetime

reviews.text: They were busy at the lodge as a part of their dam had given way and they had major flooding in some of the rooms. At no time did they neglect us. They were always stopping by to keep us informed with what was happening. When the rains finally let up a bit they tried to take us out on a game drive. We got stuck many times which was also an adventure. We saw some animals but not nearly what we might have seen if it hadn't been raining. Unfortunately it was an expensive trip and a long way to go to have all the rain we got.
reviews.title: A unforgettable December 31th

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was excellent!! Way too much food considering we were just sitting watching the rain.
reviews.title: Lifetime experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't comment too much on the game viewing but the ambiance of the lodge and the awsome people that work there is unforgettable.
reviews.title: Beautiful property with a great view and luxurious and spacious room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at this lodge with our 7 year old daughter. Our goal was to be immersed as much as possible in the savannah. Our wish was granted : since our terrace, indeed, we heard hippos in the nearby little lake and the birdsong among others.
reviews.title: Awesome Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having seen the photos on the homepage of this lodge and after comparing all the lodges,Chitwa seemed to be the best. So we booked 2 nights at Chitwa Chitwa. As we had booked over MTBEDS we got a discount on the internet room rates. Nevertheless, the room was overpriced for what it was: Our room had many stains on the carpet and even on the bed. Furthermore, the bathroom was very old, the bath tub had cracks and the toilet smelled. Just be careful with the photos on the website of the lodge. It only shows the refurbished rooms and not all of the rooms at Chitwa look like those photos!
reviews.title: Great game drives but run-down lodge

reviews.text: The game drives were really great! We saw the big 5 as well as many other animals. Also the location of the lodge next to a lake is good. However, there are other lodges with lakes closeby that looked newer.
reviews.title: If You Can, Stay Here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The whole staff was very friendly and attentive except for the management. They didn't do anything about our complaint about the room/bathroom and I felt like they were even making fun about us behind our backs. Perhaps it was because we had booked at a discounted rate. Nevertheless, it was definitely not how the management of a 5* game lodge would behave. Afterwards, I regretted having even complained about the room, because we were treated differently.
reviews.title: Trip of a lifetime

reviews.text: We loved and enjoyed the safari tours very much, but I would go to a different lodge next time!
reviews.title: Didn't Want to Leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could write a long review but most of the outstanding features of this game reserve are in the other reviews below. So I will just add: if you have a chance, come here! I really know luxury and this place is spectacular. The rooms are HUGE - 1000 square feet - with private pools and outdoor showers. Every detail is perfect. The staff is first rate and so anxious to please. But you are here for the animals and the trackers and guides are exceptional. Everyone I met here raved about their guide, but it's hard to imagine how ours (Tristan) could be surpassed by anyone. So knowledgeable and skilled and just as delighted to see the animals as we were. His tracker, Gianni, was super-human, with powers of detection that defy logic. Can anyone really see a chameleon on a high branch in the dark while the car is in motion? Anyway, we had 4 fantastic days here and, despite the 400 am wake-up call, we bounded out of bed each day for another incredible experience. Since the lodge is on a lake, there are animals to see all the time over meals and even from the shower! I agonized over which lodge to choose when planning our long-anticipated trip to Africa, so I can make it easy for you: if you have a chance, just say yes to Chitwa Chitwa! You will not be disappointed!
reviews.title: Unforgettable stay at a very unique place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just finished a phenomenal trip at Chitwa Chitwa -- 4 days of game viewing that surpassed our expectations to a greater extent than any other trip we've done -- and we've traveled a lot in the US, Europe, Asia, and the Middle East (though this was our first trip to Africa).
reviews.title: Surpassed our very high expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did a lot of research before choosing Chitwa Chitwa; there are many great properties in the Sabi Sands, but Chitwa Chitwa stood out both as a great value and because of its location right by the water, allowing us to see lots of game activity at any hour of the day. We now realize that the most important part of a stay in the Sabi Sands is the qualification of the guides and trackers. Ours (Tristan and Giyani) were truly extraordinary -- very knowledgeable and extremely adept at finding and tracking game. We saw many types of animals on every game drive, and saw all of the "big 5" more than once and up close, across the 4 days we were there. Some of the other lodges don't use separate guides and trackers, and that seems to be a big handicap; it is very difficult to look for tracks and clues to animals, talk to guests, and drive at the same time.
reviews.title: Bucket List Caliber Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Coincidentally, several journalists were staying at Chitwa Chitwa at the same time we were, after having stayed at several of the most expensive, "big name" lodges in the Sabi Sands. They told us that the game drives at Chitwa Chitwa were of the same caliber as those much more expensive lodges; from our perspective we couldn't see how they could have been better.
reviews.title: PERFECT IN EVERY WAY

reviews.text: Our room was also great -- we had room 1, as did another reviewer here, and we were very happy with it. The accommodations were on a par with what you'd expect at a Four Seasons or other high end luxury chain.
reviews.title: Experience of a Lifetime - Not to be missed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was generally fine, but for us was the weakest part of the stay. There was nothing to complain about, but it was not extraordinary in the same way that the game drives, the setting, the room and the service were. We would agree with others suggestions that they should offer more than one red and white wine by the glass.
reviews.title: MUST SEE South Africa

aka: Chitwa Chitwa Private Game Reserve Hotel
description: Originally a private retreat of the Brink family, Chitwa Chitwa was transformed by Charl into an oasis of conservation and harmony. His dedicated holistic approach and wise land management are aimed at the handing of an uncontaminated African paradise to the future generations. In 1991 Charl and Maria Brink created Chitwa Chitwa Private Game Lodge, today a jewel of South African hospitality and an emblem of the savannas most authentic and refined luxury.
